channel.title: The mind of a Pessimist
channel.description:
A piece I wrote at school today.
The mind acts mutual with it's surroundings. The people find a profound essence in the simplest of things. We exasperate our use of these, and when the true entity is revealed in it's entirety, we question our establishments prior to this epiphany. A resolution bursts, yet revolution hurts. We're hazed with our own beliefs so often that we're oppressed by our own ignorance. We're incapable of breaching the epitome of the typical thought process. We contain ourselves so compact, we have nothing else to breath but the arrogance we frolic in. We're blinded by false perception, created by incompetence and misconception. We provoke through antagonistic corruption, and regress to our pawns that support us [i]oh so voluntarily[/i] under the same said power. A hierarchy collapses in the distance only to be regulated once again in an inefficient derivation, expelling the originality and beauty it once held. It becomes a game of plucking the flower, only to replace the pedals with an artificial emptiness. The mind will often contemplate habit over choice and vice-versa, only to find that there is no real solution to perpetuation. We've created a spectrum within society in which we [u]follow[/u], yet for what is acceptable, we build upon [u]nonconformity[/u]. Ironically, we manage to contradict ourselves for as long as we coexist -- coexist being the average social minds.
Thoughts? (I cba to follow gramatical practice, eg. comma placement. It's stream of consciousness anyways, so you can't expect perfection.)

item.title: The mind of a Pessimist
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

It doesn’t make an ounce of sense. You might want to become more adept at expressing yourself before trying to tar the entire human race with a brush coated in incomprehensible gibberish.

Read full topic

i stopped reading at:

The mind acts mutual with it’s surroundings.

[/quote]For what reason?
[/quote]lack of understanding simple orthography
[/quote]I understand that the mind and it’s surrounding cannot act together in a parallel plane, if that’s what you’re getting at.[/quote]clearly you do not even know what orthography means

ps ITS NOT IT’S

item.title: The mind of a Pessimist
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Choice of Words

PLAIN words are more forceful than words less commonly used—juggle
has more vigor than prestidigitate.

SHORT words are stronger than long words—end has more directness than
terminate.

SAXON words are usually more forceful than Latinistic words—for force,
use wars against rather than militate against.

SPECIFIC words are stronger than general words—pressman is more
definite than printer.

CONNOTATIVE words, those that suggest more than they say, have more
power than ordinary words—“She let herself be married” expresses more
than “She married.”

EPITHETS, figuratively descriptive words, are more effective than direct
names—“Go tell that old fox,” has more “punch” than “Go tell that
sly fellow.” ONOMATOPOETIC words, words that convey the sense by the
sound, are more powerful than other words—crash is more effective
than cataclysm.


, said mr Dale Carnegie. It’s mainly about public speaking, but it applies to texts too. I hate it when people use words you need a dictionary for. I really makes you look arrogant.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:6, topic:337774”]writing one sentence worth of thought in 15 and using a thesaurus does not a philosopher make[/quote]Believe me or not, I didn’t use a thesaurus at all.

[quote=“Original Daniel, post:4, topic:337774”]it looks like you’re trying to sound deep, but really haven’t said anything[/quote]There’s so much in it, I don’t understand how it goes past you.

[quote=“abraham2119, post:5, topic:337774”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=434175.msg3188433#msg3188433 date=1271992796]

[quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=434175.msg3188223#msg3188223 date=1271980674]
i stopped reading at:

The mind acts mutual with it’s surroundings.

[/quote]For what reason?
[/quote]lack of understanding simple orthography[/quote]I understand that the mind and it’s surrounding cannot act together in a parallel plane, if that’s what you’re getting at.
